item.title: Manpreet add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "These woods are lovely, dark and deep, But I have promises to keep, And miles to go before I sleep, And miles to go before I sleep." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Manpreet add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "There is not a particle of life which does not bear poetry within it" -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Manpreet add a quote by Novalis
item.description: "Poetry heals the wounds inflicted by reason." -- Novalis

item.title: Manpreet add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Manpreet add a quote by Gautama Buddha
item.description: "All that we are is the result of what we have thought: it is founded on our thoughts and made up of our thoughts. If a man speak or act with an evil thought, suffering follows him as the wheel follows the hoof of the beast that draws the wagon.... If a man speak or act with a good thought, happiness follows him like a shadow that never leaves him." -- Gautama Buddha

item.title: Manpreet add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Manpreet add a quote by Oscar Levant
item.description: "There's a fine line between genius and insanity. I have erased this line." -- Oscar Levant

item.title: Manpreet add a quote by George Burns
item.description: "Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city." -- George Burns

item.title: Manpreet add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Manpreet add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "thus with a kiss I die" -- William Shakespeare
